2.text: Hear my words, O you wise men; and give ear to me, you that have knowledge.

3.text: For the ear tries words, as the mouth tastes meat.

4.text: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.

5.text: For Job has said, I am righteous: and God has taken away my judgment.

6.text: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.

7.text: What man is like Job, who drinks up scorning like water?

8.text: Which goes in company with the workers of iniquity, and walks with wicked men.

9.text: For he has said, It profits a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

10.text: Therefore listen to me you men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

11.text: For the work of a man shall he render to him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

12.text: Yes, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

13.text: Who has given him a charge over the earth? or who has disposed the whole world?

14.text: If he set his heart on man, if he gather to himself his spirit and his breath;

15.text: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again to dust.

16.text: If now you have understanding, hear this: listen to the voice of my words.

17.text: Shall even he that hates right govern? and will you condemn him that is most just?

18.text: Is it fit to say to a king, You are wicked? and to princes, You are ungodly?

19.text: How much less to him that accepts not the persons of princes, nor regards the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.

20.text: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

21.text: For his eyes are on the ways of man, and he sees all his goings.

22.text: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

23.text: For he will not lay on man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.

24.text: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

25.text: Therefore he knows their works, and he overturns them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

26.text: He strikes them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

27.text: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

28.text: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come to him, and he hears the cry of the afflicted.

29.text: When he gives quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hides his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:

30.text: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

31.text: Surely it is meet to be said to God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

32.text: That which I see not teach you me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

33.text: Should it be according to your mind? he will recompense it, whether you refuse, or whether you choose; and not I: therefore speak what you know.

34.text: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man listen to me.

35.text: Job has spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.

36.text: My desire is that Job may be tried to the end because of his answers for wicked men.

37.text: For he adds rebellion to his sin, he clapps his hands among us, and multiplies his words against God.
